2.text: This hast thou reckoned for judgment: Thou hast said—‘My righteousness is more than God’s?’

3.text: For thou sayest, ‘What doth it profit Thee! What do I profit from my sin?’

4.text: I return thee words, and thy friends with thee,

5.text: Behold attentively the heavens—and see, And behold the clouds, They have been higher than thou.

6.text: If thou hast sinned, what dost thou against Him? And thy transgressions have been multiplied, What dost thou to Him?

7.text: If thou hast been righteous, What dost thou give to Him? Or what from thy hand doth He receive?

8.text: For a man like thyself is thy wickedness, And for a son of man thy righteousness.

9.text: Because of the multitude of oppressions They cause to cry out, They cry because of the arm of the mighty.

10.text: And none said, ‘Where is God my maker? Giving songs in the night,

11.text: Teaching us more than the beasts of the earth, Yea, than the fowl of the heavens He maketh us wiser.’

12.text: There they cry, and He doth not answer, Because of the pride of evil doers.

13.text: Surely vanity God doth not hear, And the Mighty doth not behold it.

14.text: Yea, though thou sayest thou dost not behold Him, Judgment is before Him, and stay for Him.

15.text: And, now, because there is not, He hath appointed His anger, And He hath not known in great extremity.

16.text: And Job with vanity doth open his mouth, Without knowledge words he multiplieth.
